basics.name: Jack Grimes
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: I am a London-based data scientist with experience in financial services, epidemiology, engineering and physics

education.thesis: An investigation into the roles of water, sanitation, and hygiene in the control of schistosomes and other helminths
courses: GIS and Spatial Statistics using R and ArcGIS
Primary data collection in surveys: training and supervision of 41 data collectors, data collected from over 100,000 children in over 2,000 schools
Supervision of 2 M.Sc. students during my PhD work (and, more recently, an MEng student in 2020)
Fieldwork: spent around 6 months of my Ph.D. in Ethiopia - supervising data collection but also negotiating contracts, obtaining equipment, hiring staff etc
First author of 6 papers, also contributed to 5 more (see Google Scholar)
presentations: The American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene Annual Meetings (2012, 2013, and 2016)
The Wellcome Centre for Global Health Research Annual Meeting (2016)
The launch of the Centre for International Child Health at Imperial College London (2016)
The International Society for Neglected Tropical Diseases: Water Conference (2014)
Many less formal meetings in London

highlights: Predominantly using Python, Git, PyCharm, Jenkins, pandas, spaCy, scikit-learn, pytest, NetworkX
Natural language processing (NLP), network analysis, classification, clustering
High-quality (efficient and readable), production-ready tested code
Quality control and investigation of the performance of that code
Running the Modelling Interest Group, organising sessions about interesting modelling topics
Planning and delivering the Advanced Modelling and Natural Language Processing parts of the Data Science Graduate Scheme Training Programme
projects: Rectification of incorrect indicator application through supervised machine learning (spaCy, scikit-learn, tf-idf, random forests, logistic regressions)
Rectification of incorrect indicator application through unsupervised machine learning (spaCy, scikit-learn, tf-idf, k-means clustering)
Understanding the indicator portfolio through network analysis (NetworkX, netwulf)
Automatic verification of mortgage applicants' incomes
hidden_projects: Interviewing and selecting candidates for Data Science Graduate Scheme

highlights: Predominantly using Python, Git, SAS VA, Flask
Topic modelling using Gensim, Latent Dirichlet allocation, SAS VA
Presented my work widely, at internal conferences throughout the UK
hidden_projects: Fraudulent applications robot: handling fraudulent applications process with Blue Prism robotic process automation
Personal Lending Decisions robot: updating one system with data from another with Blue Prism robotic process automation
Robotics/facial recognition integration: integrating machine learning solutions into Blue Prism robotic process automation
Credit strategy emulator: VBA code to run (and save results of) credit models. VBA and SAS/Le Mans integration
HIVE leaders macro (VBA to scrape from internal web page)
Coffee club (Flask app to encourage networking between colleagues)
Python App to scrape and summarise regulations from FCA website
projects: Face recognition for fraud prevention (Flask, face_recognition, python)
Natural language processing to understand complaints made to the Financial Ombudsman Service (Gensim, SAS VA, Latent Dirichlet Analysis
Predictive model of falling into financial difficulty (scikit-learn, pandas, imblearn)
Predictive model of fraudulent transactions in commercial bank accounts (scikit-learn, pandas, imblearn)
Web app to scrape macroeconomic indicators from the Bank of England website (bokeh, urllib, pandas)

highlights: Concluding analyses of data collected during my PhD
projects: Mixed effects logistic regression to assess the relationships between environmental risk factors, parasites, and overall health, using R and lme4) (paper)
Using parasite infection intensity and Box-Cox transformations, for more accurate estimations of parasite infection prevalence (using R)

awards.title: Best presentation
awards.awarder: Wellcome Centre for Global Health Research Annual Meeting
awards.summary: My presentation on my PhD findings won the 'Best Presentation' award.

awards.title: Collections (exam) prize
awards.summary: I won a prize for achievement in the college exams.

courses.course: Bayesian Statistics: From Concept to Data Analysis
courses.provider: Coursera, University of California, Santa Cruz

highlights: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization
